dublin_core.dcvalue: Internet technologies provide an attractive infrastructure for efficient and low cost communications in regional health information networks The advantages provided by the Internet come however with a significantly greater element of risk to the confidentiality and integrity of information This is because the Internet has been designed primarily to optimize information sharing and interoperability not security The main objective of this paper is to propose the exploitation of public key cryptography techniques to provide adequate security to enable secure healthcare Internet applications
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:46:47Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2002-12-27
Developing a Public Key Infrastructure for a secure regional e-Health environment.
